thisutils 0.0.3
  • Reference

Split indices.

Source: R/RcppExports.R
split_indices.Rd

An optimised version of split for the special case of splitting row indices into groups.

Usage

split_indices(group, n = 0L)

Arguments

group

Integer indices

n

The largest integer (may not appear in index). This is hint: if the largest value of group is bigger than n, the output will silently expand.

Value

A list of vectors of indices.

References

https://github.com/hadley/plyr/blob/d57f9377eb5d56107ba3136775f2f0f005f33aa3/src/split-numeric.cpp#L20

Examples

split_indices(sample(10, 100, rep = TRUE))
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 14 30 34 55 56 61 62 86 90 91 97
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1]  17  19  24  26  35  58  72  99 100
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 49 50 75 77 78
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1]  1  4  6  8 12 21 41 43 46 57 73 80 94
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1]  3 23 29 47 48 74 84 96
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1]  9 31 32 36 38 39 42 53 66
#> 
#> [[7]]
#>  [1]  2  5 10 25 28 67 68 71 82 87
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1]  7 13 54 59 65 70 79 89
#> 
#> [[9]]
#>  [1] 11 18 20 37 40 45 51 52 63 64 69 76 85 88 92 93 95 98
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] 15 16 22 27 33 44 60 81 83
#> 
split_indices(sample(10, 100, rep = TRUE), 10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 18 63 77 80 84 96
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  6 12 17 52 57 70 71 85 90 98
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1] 11 27 34 47 50 60 67 69 73 79
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1]  2  4 19 20 35 43 44 53 56 62 68 74 83 88 93 97
#> 
#> [[5]]
#>  [1]  7 10 13 16 26 37 45 64 72 78 86
#> 
#> [[6]]
#>  [1]   5  22  23  31  40  41  81  87  91  94  99 100
#> 
#> [[7]]
#>  [1]  3 14 25 29 30 32 38 51 54 55 58 59
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1]  1  9 21 28 33 36 42 66 95
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1]  8 15 24 46 48 49 61 89
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] 39 65 75 76 82 92
#>
